entry.title: Fine-grained PATs can access Enterprise APIs [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Today, only PATs (Personal Access Tokens) Classic can interact with the Enterprise account - managing SCIM and users, creating organizations, setting policy, and provisioning self-hosted runners, as popular examples. By switching to fine-grained PATs for these APIs, enterprises get a better least-privilege security posture. With this release, you can use tokens with just enough permission to accomplish the job instead of a PAT (Classic) that requires permission to do anything to your enterprise.

Expected Outcome

This release trails #793, which establishes the fine-grained permissions model for the enterprise. Because each API must be updated individually to support new permissions, not every single API will be supported at the time of the public preview. We are prioritizing the most popular APIs to ensure that enterprises can replace the highest number of PATs (Classic), and will ship with at least those for the public preview.

These APIs are:

  1. Self-hosted runner management
  2. Organization creation
  3. SCIM support, for platforms that cannot use a GitHub App for provisioning
  4. Enterprise team creation and management
  5. Budgeting and Licensing management

entry.title: Fine-grained PATs can target multiple organizations in an enterprise [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Today, fine-grained PATs (Personal Access Tokens) can only be targeted to a single organization, which can be very restrictive for developers who's workflows span multiple organizations. Right now they're stuck juggling multiple tokens, or more likely falling back to PATs (Classic) at the cost of improved security.

With multi-targeting, a single fine-grained PAT can be given access to multiple organizations at once, allowing more developers to move off of PATs (Classic).

Expected Outcome

When creating a fine-grained PAT, developers can pick which enterprise they'd like to target, and then select the organizations within that enterprise the token should be valid for. The permissions selected for the token will be the same in each organization - selecting specific permissions per organization is not supported in this release.

For each organization that has an approval process setup, the token will have to be approved. Organization access will light up on a one by one basis as those approvals are granted.

At this time, for the sake of governance and isolation, we are not looking to let a token access multiple unrelated organizations. Thus, Free-plan and Team-plan organizations you are a member of would still have to be individually targeted with a token.

entry.title: Repository creation Form Refresh [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Simplify repository creation with a dynamic, user-centric design that adapts to custom properties, enabling seamless metadata collection, policy-driven enforcement, and rule-compliant repository setups.

Expected Outcome

Ensure repository creation is a seamless and efficient experience for all users. By incorporating custom properties, the process enables upfront metadata collection, ensuring accuracy and completeness. Additionally, it promotes policy-backed creations, enforcing compliance with repository rulesets, and delivering well-structured, rule-compliant repositories tailored to an organizations needs.

entry.title: Fine-grained Personal Access Tokens [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

After over two years in public beta, we've seen millions of requests a day using Fine-Grained PATs and adoption across the platform - enough to say that it's time to call them GA. While there's more work to be done before we can say they entirely replace PATs (Classic), we know that fine-grained PATs aren't going anywhere and are ready for production use in your company, unlocking= visibility and control over the tokens used to access your organizations, and finer-grained permissions to ensure least privilege access.

This release also brings PAT expiration policies (for fine-grained PATs and PATs (Classic)) to GA as well, allowing you to force the rotation of PATs in your enterprise or organization.

Expected Outcome

In the public preview, fine-grained PATs were an opt-in mechanism for organizations - if a user wanted to create a fine-grained PAT with access to an organization, the organization had to first allow fine-grained PATs to be created at all.

With this change, fine-grained PATs will be enabled by default for all organizations. Organizations and enterprises that explicitly blocked fine-grained PATs during the preview will continue to have them disabled with this GA.

Remaining limitations with GA

This is not the end of the story for fine-grained PATs. Our intent is to continue investing in them to ensure that they can entirely replace the use of PATs (Classic) in your workflows, letting you get the best security possible no matter where you use them. We know there are gaps in the fine-grained PATs implementation that may prevent you from using them everywhere, and we will continue working on fine-grained PATs to unblock your use cases.

Critically, this milestone does not include interactions with the Enterprise object. This means enterprise role management, organization creation, SCIM user management, and enterprise audit logs, among other enterprise APIs, will not be possible with a fine-grained PAT. Supporting enterprise object access with a fine-grained PAT or GitHub App is an ongoing project that will ensure full parity with PATs (Classic) and OAuth apps.

There are also organization- and repository-level gaps that we need to fill, to ensure that every API and every developer workflow is unblocked.

These items include:

  • #790
  • #600
  • #601
  • #558

As we continue to invest in improvements to fine-grained PATs and the modern permissions platform, we hope you'll find more ways to reduce your use of PATs (Classic).

entry.title: Copilot in VS Code v1.99 | March release [GA]
entry.content:
Agent Mode GA + Unified Copilot Panel

Value Prop

GitHub Copilot Agent Mode acts as an AI-powered peer programmer, proactively analyzing project requirements and executing complex tasks. It autonomously generates functional applications, reducing project kickoff time from hours to minutes. Developers maintain oversight through transparent edit proposals, ensuring quality and accuracy in the final output.

Expected Outcome

Agent Mode will transform how developers work in their editor by automating broader aspects of the development process. It iterates on its own outputs to complete entire user requests in one go, automatically fixes errors, suggests terminal commands, and assesses run-time errors. This capability will be available for VS Code and later coming to more IDEs, enabling developers to focus on creative aspects rather than tedious coding tasks.

MCP Server Support (Preview)

Value Prop

Stay ahead of the curve with GitHub Copilot and MCP in VS Code. This open standard integration enables your AI assistant to leverage company knowledge bases, proprietary APIs, and specialized tools - creating a personalized coding experience that grows with your needs.

Expected Outcome

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration will create a seamless connection between MCP tool servers and GitHub Copilot Chat. Developers will be able to manage multiple MCP servers through an intuitive UI, automatically discover available tools, and invoke them directly through Copilot Chat. This will expand Copilot's capabilities beyond code generation to include specialized tools and resources that enhance the development workflow.

Next Edit Suggestions (NES) GA

Value Prop

Stay in your coding flow with Next Edit Suggestions. No more mentally tracking all the places that need updating when you change variable names or refactor classes. Copilot intelligently predicts the logical sequence of edits, allowing you to Tab through suggested changes and maintain perfect focus on the bigger picture of your code architecture.

Expected Outcome

Next Edit Suggestions will extend Copilot's capabilities beyond writing new code to improving the editing experience for existing code. When developers make a change, Copilot will predict subsequent changes needed throughout the project and present them in sequence. This feature will help developers maintain focus on their main tasks by automatically identifying and suggesting edits based on previous changes, accessible with a simple Tab key press.

Codex v2 GA

Value Prop

GitHub Copilot's GPT-4o model accelerates development with faster code completions, reducing latency by up to 60% for seamless collaboration. It supports over 30 programming languages, with expertise in modern frameworks like Next.js and Python, delivering contextually accurate suggestions aligned with contemporary standards. Enhanced contextual awareness enables precise, cohesive completions that respect existing code patterns and project conventions, reducing editing needs while improving code quality. This combination boosts productivity and streamlines the coding experience for developers.

Expected Outcome

The improved AI model behind GitHub Copilot will deliver faster code suggestions with a 13% latency improvement over the previous OpenAI Codex model. Enhanced contextual filtering will take into account a wider range of developer context and usage patterns, resulting in a 6% relative improvement in code acceptance rate. These improvements will allow developers to focus more on creative aspects of their work and tackle more ambitious projects more quickly.

"Bring Your Own Keys" Support

Value Prop

Connect your preferred LLM provider APIs to GitHub Copilot in VS Code while maintaining its seamless coding experience. Whether you prefer Claude, GPT-4o, or specialized models, BYOK lets you customize your AI pair programmer without sacrificing Copilot's productivity benefits. Leverage specialized models for specific coding tasks while enjoying Copilot's intuitive IDE integration and contextual understanding of your codebase.

Expected Outcome

The BYOK feature will give developers flexibility to choose their preferred language models while maintaining Copilot's integrated experience in VS Code. This will be particularly valuable for teams with specific model preferences or requirements, allowing them to customize their AI assistance while retaining the productivity benefits of Copilot's IDE integration.

Support for URL Fetching

Value Prop

Code with confidence using real-time web data: GitHub Copilot's URL fetching brings the latest API documentation, library updates, and coding standards directly into your workflow. Stay current with evolving technologies without manual research.

Expected Outcome

URL fetching will enable Copilot to incorporate up-to-date information from the web directly into the development workflow. This will reduce context switching for developers who would otherwise need to manually search for documentation or references, keeping them in flow and ensuring they have access to the most current information when writing code.

entry.title: GPT-4o Copilot (Codex V2) code completion model [GA]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

The GPT-4o Copilot model is built on the latest GPT-4o mini base model. To makes the model's knowledge even more recent, and to ensure that it has been trained on a diverse and comprehensive set of examples, the model has been fine-tuned using 275k high-quality public repositories. These repositories span more than 30 programming languages, which means that the model is versatile and can assist developers working in a wide range of coding environments.

Expected Outcome

Developers can integrate this model into their coding workflow to benefit from faster and more accurate code suggestions. This integration can significantly enhance productivity by reducing the time spent on writing boilerplate code and by providing intelligent suggestions that improve code quality. As a result, developers can focus more on solving complex problems and less on routine coding tasks, leading to more efficient and effective software development.

entry.title: Incremental CodeQL analysis reduces scan times during Pull Requests [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

CodeQL is the static analysis engine that powers GitHub’s code scanning capabilities. In Pull Requests, it can pinpoint potential vulnerabilities and deliver detailed insights alongside automated remediation suggestions through Copilot Autofix. With this update, CodeQL queries focus exclusively on newly introduced code rather than rescanning the entire codebase, streamlining the analysis process.

Expected Outcome

Developers receive faster feedback during Pull Requests, reducing the time needed to identify and fix emerging vulnerabilities. This speed enhancement maintains the same quality of results on the Pull Requests page while accelerating the remediation process, enabling teams to secure their code more efficiently without compromising on thoroughness.

entry.title: JetBrains Copilot Multi-Model Selection Support [GA]
entry.content:
Value Proposition

The Multi-Model Selection Support in JetBrains is a powerful feature that allows users to experiment with different AI models within chat interfaces and for code completions. This feature addresses the need for flexibility and customization in AI model selection, enabling users to find the best model for their specific needs. This approach makes the Multi-Model Selection an invaluable tool for experiencing the latest AI model functionalities and optimizing AI-driven conversations and completion tasks.

Expected Outcome

With the Multi-Model Selection Support in JetBrains, developers can expect to significantly improve their chat interactions and code completions by selecting the most suitable AI model for their needs. Developers will benefit from the ability to quickly experiment with different models, leading to better performance and higher satisfaction. Additionally, this feature will increase user stickiness to our plugin and help further fill the feature parity compared to VS Code.

entry.title: GitHub Copilot Chat for Eclipse [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

GitHub Copilot for Eclipse Chat introduces AI-powered conversational assistance directly within the Eclipse IDE. This feature allows developers to ask coding-related questions, receive explanations, and get real-time support while writing code. By providing instant AI-driven guidance, Copilot for Eclipse Chat helps developers resolve issues faster, understand complex coding concepts, and stay in the flow without leaving their development environment. This interactive AI assistant enhances problem-solving and reduces dependencies on external searches.

Expected Outcome

With GitHub Copilot for Eclipse Chat, developers will experience faster issue resolution and improved understanding of their codebase. The conversational AI assistant empowers teams to code with greater confidence, reducing frustration and increasing efficiency. As developers receive real-time support without context-switching, productivity and software quality improve, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable development experience.

entry.title: GitHub Copilot Code Completion for Eclipse [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

GitHub Copilot for Eclipse Code Completion leverages AI to provide intelligent, real-time code suggestions, significantly enhancing developer productivity. By understanding context and predicting the next lines of code, it helps developers write code faster and with fewer errors. This seamless integration into the Eclipse IDE reduces the need for constant reference checks and allows developers to stay focused on their tasks. With Copilot’s AI-driven completions, developers can accelerate their coding workflows and minimize the time spent on repetitive coding patterns.

Expected Outcome

With GitHub Copilot for Eclipse Code Completion, developers will experience a more streamlined coding process, reducing time spent on manual code writing and debugging. The AI-powered suggestions improve code accuracy and efficiency, leading to higher-quality software output. Teams can expect to see a boost in development speed and overall productivity, making Eclipse an even more powerful environment for modern software development.

entry.title: GitHub Copilot Chat for Xcode [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

GitHub Copilot for Xcode Chat brings AI-powered conversational coding assistance to Apple developers, enabling seamless integration into the Xcode IDE. With the ability to answer queries, provide code explanations, and suggest improvements in real-time, this feature transforms the development experience for iOS and macOS applications. By leveraging AI-driven insights, developers can quickly resolve coding challenges and optimize their workflows, ultimately accelerating application development.

Expected Outcome

With GitHub Copilot for Xcode Chat, Apple developers can expect more efficient coding sessions, faster debugging, and enhanced problem-solving capabilities. The AI assistant reduces the need for external research, keeping developers focused within Xcode. This leads to higher developer satisfaction, improved code quality, and shorter development cycles, making it an invaluable tool for iOS and macOS development teams.

entry.title: Support Multi-Models Selection in Copilot Chat on GitHub Mobile [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

We are bringing multi-model choice to GitHub Mobile to accelerate your workflow, whether you’re tackling coding questions, brainstorming ideas, or working on the go.

Expected Outcome

With this update, users would be able to select different models from the Copilot Chat UI on GitHub Mobile to get the best results based on specific use case.

entry.title: Copilot Free in GitHub CLI [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Developers can now use the gh-copilot extension to interact with Copilot in the GitHub CLI on the Copilot Free tier.

Expected Outcome

With this update, developers can start using the gh-copilot extension for the GitHub CLI, using their 50 chat messages per month to get suggestions for and explanations of gh, git, and other terminal commands from Copilot. When the quota is hit, users can head to GitHub.com to purchase a Copilot Pro subscription.

entry.title: Copilot Search on GitHub Docs [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

The new Copilot Search on docs.github.com transforms how teams interact with GitHub documentation. Copilot Search compiles comprehensive, actionable responses with links to related documentation, helping teams quickly resolve issues, discover tools, and improve their productivity with fewer interruptions.

Expected Outcome

Teams can expect faster issue resolution through direct answers. With less time spent searching and troubleshooting, teams will enhance productivity and reduce dependency on support.

entry.title: Dependabot supports configuration of a minimum package age before creating a PR [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

This feature allows Dependabot users to optionally configure a delay for opening a Dependabot PR for a newly updated dependency until a certain amount of time has passed.

Expected Outcome

The cooldown feature helps teams improve security and reduce noise from frequent dependency updates by delaying Dependabot PRs for a configurable period, allowing time for patch releases and stabilizing updates without disrupting project workflows.

entry.title: Audit history for Projects [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

We are providing users with the ability to view and understand changes to a project and its items over time with an audit history log. This will allow them to see what changes were made, who made the changes, and when they were changed, allowing them to understand (and if needed, reverse action on) activity such as when an item was moved from Low priority to High priority.

Expected Outcome

An audit history log would give more visibility into how a project and its items change over time, allowing users to track specific changes, understand how project items progress in a project with its custom fields, and reverse an action if it was unintended.

entry.title: GitHub Actions: Immutable Actions Publishing [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

We are building a new way to publish and consume actions that will improve the security of the CI/CD supply chain. Building on top of the OCI distribution specification, actions can now be pushed to GitHub Packages as immutable image versions with familiar semantic versions. The immutable packages and semantic versions bring greater predictability and security to users' workflows.

Expected Outcome

Users consuming actions will be able to reference an immutable package of an action by version, providing better security in their CI/CD supply chain. Over time we will build additional functionality like signing, build attestation, malware scanning, etc. to further improve the security of the supply chain and allow organizations to apply more specific policies. Developers creating Actions will have a fully automated workflow for publishing their actions that follows a natural build, package, and publish model with standard package versioning.

Actions publishers will use a new packaging action and workflow to take their existing actions code and publish it to GitHub Packages. Users consuming actions by version tags will automatically start getting the packaged version of the action after it is published. Those referencing by commit SHA or git branch reference will simply need to switch to an appropriate version.

entry.title: Improved Pull Request Files Changed Page [Public Preview]
entry.content:
Value Prop

The Pull Request Files Changed page is being improved to provide more context at a glance, reduce distractions with improved filtering options, provide easier acccess to comments, support larger and more complex pull requests, and make the experience more accessible to everyone.

Expected Outcome

These changes will improve the code review experience, while still remaining familiar to existing users. These improvements will make it easier to review changes (especially larger ones), stay on top of conversations, focus on the most relevant changes to you, all of which will help reduce review time, improve code quality, and improve velocity.

entry.title: Dependabot version updates support `bun` package manager - [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Bun is an all-in-one JavaScript runtime & toolkit designed for speed, complete with a bundler, test runner, and Node.js-compatible package manager. Today, customers cannot use the bun package manager with Dependabot. It's the most upvoted customer request in dependabot-core.

Expected Outcome

This enables customers who use bun to get version updates from Dependabot.

entry.title: Dependabot version updates support `uv` package manager - [GA]
entry.content:
Value Prop

Today, customers cannot use the uv package manager with Dependabot. It's one of the the most upvoted customer requests in dependabot-core.

Expected Outcome

This enables customers who use uv to get version updates from Dependabot.
